Based on Entities.csv and Relationships.csv - Proceed and Create 3 individual CSV code-blocks (alternative: files) in chat named: Goals.csv + Conditions.csv + DecisionVariables.csv
Goals.csv must have the following header: "ID,Name,Description,IsSum,GoalType,EntityName,EntityAttribute,CriteriaType,Weight"
Conditions.csv must have the following header: "ID,Name,Description,IsSum,GoalType,EntityName,EntityAttribute,CriteriaType,Weight"
DecisionVariables.csv must have the following header: "ID,Name,Description,DataType,Domain,MinValue,MaxValue"

The following conventions must be applied:
ID starts with a letter G(oals), C(onditions), D(ecision)V(ariables) and a number follows, starting at 0, 1, 2, ....
Name is written snake_case
Names for Goals must begin with "maximize_" or "minimize_"
IsSum is a boolean { True, False }
GoalType is one of { "min", "max" }
EntityName is always only 1 entry from the "Name" of Entities.csv
EntityAttribute is one of the values in the "Attribute0" to "Attribute8" of the targeted Entity in Entities.csv
CriteriaType is a number { 2 = Must-Match, 1 = May-Match, 0 = Cannot-Match }
Domain can represent set of values like "{0,1}"
MinValue is the smallest value that can be set
MaxValue is the highest value that can be set
Weight is a mulptlier
Created 10 to 15 entries in each of these files.

### ðŸ“ Notes:
- **EntityName** and **EntityAttribute** strictly reference entries from `Entities.csv`.
- **CriteriaType**:  
  - `2` = Must-Match (hard constraint or strong objective)  
  - `1` = May-Match (soft preference)  
  - `0` = Cannot-Match (prohibition)
- **IsSum** indicates whether multiple instances should be summed (e.g., total story points) or evaluated individually (e.g., duration).
- **Weights** reflect relative importance (higher = more important).
- **Decision Variables** are modeled as optimization or planning variables with realistic domains and bounds.

Let me know if you'd like these exported as downloadable files or extended for use in optimization models (e.g., linear programming).

Use ALL of the previously provided and generated CSV data (Entities, Relations, Goals, Conditions, DecisionVariables) and formulate the optimization model mathematically and logically. 
Write it into a code-block for a LaTeX (.tex) file and provide the generated Latex code in chat.
The file consists of a introduction page with Title, Author, Date and Table of Contents.
The actual file contest consists of 5 different \sections labeled "1. Sets (Entities)", "2. Indices", "3. Goals", "4. Conditions", "5. DecisionVariables"
The items of each category are itemized between \begin and \end.
Goals and Conditions show both their IDs, Names and the logical and mathematical representation

content_list.content:
Here is the complete LaTeX `.tex` file code, formatted with a title page, author, date, table of contents, and five structured sections. It integrates all previously defined CSV data into a formal optimization model with mathematical and logical expressions for **Goals** and **Conditions**.

```latex
\documentclass[12pt]{article}
\usepackage{amsmath, amssymb, geometry, hyperref, enumitem}
\geometry{margin=1in}
\title{Optimization Model for SCRUM-Based Software Development}
\author{Domain Modeling System}
\date{\today}

\begin{document}

\maketitle

\tableofcontents
\newpage

\section{1. Sets (Entities)}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $ \mathcal{P} $: Set of Projects $ = \{ p \in \text{Project} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{T} $: Set of Teams $ = \{ t \in \text{Team} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{W} $: Set of Workers $ = \{ w \in \text{Worker} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{F} $: Set of Features $ = \{ f \in \text{Feature} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{S} $: Set of Skills $ = \{ s \in \text{Skill} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{R} $: Set of Roles $ = \{ r \in \text{Role} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{PO} $: Set of Product Owners $ = \{ po \in \text{ProductOwner} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SM} $: Set of Scrum Masters $ = \{ sm \in \text{ScrumMaster} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{PB} $: Set of Product Backlogs $ = \{ pb \in \text{ProductBacklog} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SP} $: Set of Sprints $ = \{ sp \in \text{Sprint} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SPP} $: Set of Sprint Plannings $ = \{ spp \in \text{SprintPlanning} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{DS} $: Set of Daily Scrums $ = \{ ds \in \text{DailyScrum} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SR} $: Set of Sprint Reviews $ = \{ sr \in \text{SprintReview} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SRE} $: Set of Sprint Retrospectives $ = \{ sre \in \text{SprintRetrospective} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SBL} $: Set of Sprint Backlogs $ = \{ sbl \in \text{SprintBacklog} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SG} $: Set of Sprint Goals $ = \{ sg \in \text{SprintGoal} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{E} $: Set of Epics $ = \{ e \in \text{Epic} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{US} $: Set of User Stories $ = \{ us \in \text{UserStory} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{TSK} $: Set of Tasks $ = \{ tsk \in \text{Task} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{DEV} $: Set of Development Snapshots $ = \{ dev \in \text{DevelopmentSnapshot} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{BL} $: Set of Blockers $ = \{ bl \in \text{Blocker} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SH} $: Set of Stakeholders $ = \{ sh \in \text{Stakeholder} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{VEL} $: Set of Velocity Records $ = \{ vel \in \text{Velocity} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{REP} $: Set of Release Plans $ = \{ rep \in \text{ReleasePlan} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{RM} $: Set of Roadmaps $ = \{ rm \in \text{Roadmap} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SCB} $: Set of Scrum Boards $ = \{ scb \in \text{ScrumBoard} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{FED} $: Set of Feature Documentations $ = \{ fed \in \text{FeatureDocumentation} \} $
\end{itemize}

\section{2. Indices}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $ p \in \mathcal{P} $: Index for Projects
    \item $ t \in \mathcal{T} $: Index for Teams
    \item $ w \in \mathcal{W} $: Index for Workers
    \item $ f \in \mathcal{F} $: Index for Features
    \item $ s \in \mathcal{S} $: Index for Skills
    \item $ r \in \mathcal{R} $: Index for Roles
    \item $ po \in \mathcal{PO} $: Index for Product Owners
    \item $ sm \in \mathcal{SM} $: Index for Scrum Masters
    \item $ pb \in \mathcal{PB} $: Index for Product Backlogs
    \item $ sp \in \mathcal{SP} $: Index for Sprints
    \item $ sbl \in \mathcal{SBL} $: Index for Sprint Backlogs
    \item $ sg \in \mathcal{SG} $: Index for Sprint Goals
    \item $ e \in \mathcal{E} $: Index for Epics
    \item $ us \in \mathcal{US} $: Index for User Stories
    \item $ tsk \in \mathcal{TSK} $: Index for Tasks
    \item $ bl \in \mathcal{BL} $: Index for Blockers
    \item $ sh \in \mathcal{SH} $: Index for Stakeholders
    \item $ vel \in \mathcal{VEL} $: Index for Velocity Records
    \item $ rep \in \mathcal{REP} $: Index for Release Plans
    \item $ rm \in \mathcal{RM} $: Index for Roadmaps
    \item $ fed \in \mathcal{FED} $: Index for Feature Documentations
\end{itemize}

\section{3. Goals}
\begin{itemize}
    \item \textbf{G0: maximize\_team\_productivity} \\
    Maximize average story points completed per sprint. \\
    $ \max \sum_{vel \in \mathcal{VEL}} \text{avg\_story\_points}(vel) \times \text{Weight}_{G0} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G0} = 1.2 $

    \item \textbf{G1: minimize\_sprint\_blockers} \\
    Minimize number of unresolved blockers. \\
    $ \min \sum_{bl \in \mathcal{BL}} \mathbb{I}[\text{status}(bl) \neq \text{'resolved'}] \times \text{Weight}_{G1} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G1} = 1.5 $

    \item \textbf{G2: maximize\_feature\_completion} \\
    Maximize number of completed features. \\
    $ \max \sum_{f \in \mathcal{F}} \mathbb{I}[\text{status}(f) = \text{'completed'}] \times \text{Weight}_{G2} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G2} = 1.3 $

    \item \textbf{G3: minimize\_project\_duration} \\
    Minimize total project duration. \\
    $ \min \sum_{p \in \mathcal{P}} (\text{project\_end}(p) - \text{project\_start}(p)) \times \text{Weight}_{G3} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G3} = 1.1 $

    \item \textbf{G4: maximize\_worker\_utilization} \\
    Maximize worker availability. \\
    $ \max \sum_{w \in \mathcal{W}} \text{availability}(w) \times \text{Weight}_{G4} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G4} = 0.9 $

    \item \textbf{G5: minimize\_task\_effort\_deviation} \\
    Minimize deviation between estimated and actual effort. \\
    $ \min \sum_{tsk \in \mathcal{TSK}} |\text{effort}(tsk) - \text{actual\_effort}(tsk)| \times \text{Weight}_{G5} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G5} = 1.0 $

    \item \textbf{G6: maximize\_stakeholder\_influence} \\
    Maximize involvement of high-influence stakeholders. \\
    $ \max \sum_{sh \in \mathcal{SH}} \text{influence\_level}(sh) \times \text{Weight}_{G6} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G6} = 0.8 $

    \item \textbf{G7: minimize\_epic\_estimated\_effort} \\
    Minimize total estimated effort for epics. \\
    $ \min \sum_{e \in \mathcal{E}} \text{estimated\_effort}(e) \times \text{Weight}_{G7} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G7} = 1.2 $

    \item \textbf{G8: maximize\_sprint\_goal\_achievement} \\
    Maximize number of achieved sprint goals. \\
    $ \max \sum_{sg \in \mathcal{SG}} \mathbb{I}[\text{achievement\_status}(sg) = \text{'achieved'}] \times \text{Weight}_{G8} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G8} = 1.4 $

    \item \textbf{G9: minimize\_daily\_scrum\_duration} \\
    Minimize average daily scrum duration. \\
    $ \min \frac{1}{|\mathcal{DS}|} \sum_{ds \in \mathcal{DS}} \text{duration}(ds) \times \text{Weight}_{G9} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G9} = 0.7 $

    \item \textbf{G10: maximize\_documentation\_coverage} \\
    Maximize features with linked documentation. \\
    $ \max \sum_{fed \in \mathcal{FED}} \mathbb{I}[\text{linked\_requirements}(fed) \neq \emptyset] \times \text{Weight}_{G10} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G10} = 0.9 $

    \item \textbf{G11: minimize\_release\_plan\_delays} \\
    Minimize delayed release plans. \\
    $ \min \sum_{rep \in \mathcal{REP}} \mathbb{I}[\text{status}(rep) = \text{'delayed'}] \times \text{Weight}_{G11} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G11} = 1.3 $

    \item \textbf{G12: maximize\_team\_stability} \\
    Maximize number of active teams. \\
    $ \max \sum_{t \in \mathcal{T}} \mathbb{I}[\text{team\_status}(t) = \text{'active'}] \times \text{Weight}_{G12} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G12} = 1.0 $

    \item \textbf{G13: minimize\_worker\_turnover} \\
    Minimize inactive workers. \\
    $ \min \sum_{w \in \mathcal{W}} \mathbb{I}[\text{status}(w) = \text{'inactive'}] \times \text{Weight}_{G13} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G13} = 1.4 $

    \item \textbf{G14: maximize\_sprint\_velocity\_trend} \\
    Maximize positive velocity trend. \\
    $ \max \sum_{vel \in \mathcal{VEL}} \text{trend}(vel) \times \text{Weight}_{G14} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G14} = 1.1 $
\end{itemize}

\section{4. Conditions}
\begin{itemize}
    \item \textbf{C0: require\_worker\_email} \\
    Every worker must have a valid email. \\
    $ \forall w \in \mathcal{W}: \text{email}(w) \neq \text{null} \land \text{email}(w) \text{ matches } \texttt{email\_regex} $

    \item \textbf{C1: require\_unique\_role\_assignment} \\
    A worker can assume only one role per team. \\
    $ \forall w \in \mathcal{W}, t \in \mathcal{T}: \left| \{ r \in \mathcal{R} \mid (w,r) \in \text{takes\_on\_role} \land w \in t \} \right| \leq 1 $

    \item \textbf{C2: enforce\_sprint\_duration} \\
    Sprint duration must be 1 to 4 weeks. \\
    $ \forall sp \in \mathcal{SP}: 7 \leq (\text{end\_date}(sp) - \text{start\_date}(sp)) \leq 28 \text{ days} $

    \item \textbf{C3: require\_product\_backlog\_entries} \\
    Product Backlog must have at least one entry. \\
    $ \forall pb \in \mathcal{PB}: \text{number\_of\_entries}(pb) \geq 1 $

    \item \textbf{C4: ensure\_task\_status\_validity} \\
    Task status must be valid. \\
    $ \forall tsk \in \mathcal{TSK}: \text{status}(tsk) \in \{ \text{todo}, \text{in\_progress}, \text{done} \} $

    \item \textbf{C5: require\_sprint\_goal\_defined} \\
    Every sprint must have a defined goal. \\
    $ \forall sp \in \mathcal{SP}: \exists sg \in \mathcal{SG} \mid \text{pursues\_goal}(sp, sg) \land \text{objective\_description}(sg) \neq \text{null} $

    \item \textbf{C6: enforce\_user\_story\_priority} \\
    User Story must have a priority level. \\
    $ \forall us \in \mathcal{US}: \text{priority}(us) \in \{1,2,3\} $

    \item \textbf{C7: require\_feature\_title} \\
    Feature must have a title. \\
    $ \forall f \in \mathcal{F}: \text{title}(f) \neq \text{null} \land \text{title}(f) \neq "" $

    \item \textbf{C8: ensure\_team\_size\_within\_range} \\
    Team size must be between 3 and 9. \\
    $ \forall t \in \mathcal{T}: 3 \leq \text{team\_size}(t) \leq 9 $

    \item \textbf{C9: require\_epic\_status} \\
    Epic must have a valid status. \\
    $ \forall e \in \mathcal{E}: \text{status}(e) \in \{ \text{planned}, \text{in\_progress}, \text{done} \} $

    \item \textbf{C10: enforce\_documentation\_author} \\
    Feature documentation must have an author. \\
    $ \forall fed \in \mathcal{FED}: \text{author}(fed) \neq \text{null} $

    \item \textbf{C11: require\_sprint\_review\_attendees} \\
    Sprint Review must have attendees. \\
    $ \forall sr \in \mathcal{SR}: \text{attendees\_count}(sr) \geq 1 $

    \item \textbf{C12: ensure\_blocker\_severity} \\
    Blocker must have a severity level. \\
    $ \forall bl \in \mathcal{BL}: \text{severity}(bl) \in \{ \text{low}, \text{medium}, \text{high}, \text{critical} \} $

    \item \textbf{C13: require\_release\_version} \\
    Release Plan must specify a version. \\
    $ \forall rep \in \mathcal{REP}: \text{version}(rep) \neq \text{null} $

    \item \textbf{C14: enforce\_roadmap\_milestones} \\
    Roadmap must include milestones. \\
    $ \forall rm \in \mathcal{RM}: \text{milestones}(rm) \neq \text{null} \land |\text{milestones}(rm)| \geq 1 $
\end{itemize}

\section{5. DecisionVariables}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $ \mathbf{x}_{tsk,w} \in \{0,1\} $: Task assignment â€” 1 if task $ tsk $ is assigned to worker $ w $, else 0.
    \item $ a_w \in [0, 40] \subset \mathbb{R} $: Weekly availability of worker $ w $ in hours.
    \item $ d_{sp} \in \{1,2,3,4\} $: Duration of sprint $ sp $ in weeks.
    \item $ s_t \in [3,9] \subset \mathbb{Z} $: Size of team $ t $.
    \item $ sp_{us} \in [1,13] \subset \mathbb{Z} $: Story points estimated for user story $ us $.
    \item $ e_{tsk} \in [0, 40] \subset \mathbb{R} $: Effort (in hours) planned for task $ tsk $.
    \item $ p_f \in \{1,2,3\} $: Priority level of feature $ f $.
    \item $ p_{us} \in \{1,2,3\} $: Priority of user story $ us $.
    \item $ \tau_{rep} \in [1704067200, 2085984000] \subset \mathbb{Z} $: Unix timestamp of planned release date for $ rep $.
    \item $ n_{vel} \in [2,6] \subset \mathbb{Z} $: Number of sprints used in velocity calculation.
    \item $ \delta_{fed} \in \{0,1\} $: 1 if documentation $ fed $ is complete, else 0.
    \item $ r_{bl} \in [0, 720] \subset \mathbb{R} $: Time (in hours) to resolve blocker $ bl $.
    \item $ \gamma_{sg} \in [0.0, 1.0] \subset \mathbb{R} $: Achievement score of sprint goal $ sg $.
    \item $ l_s \in [1,5] \subset \mathbb{Z} $: Skill level of worker in skill $ s $.
    \item $ \ell_t \in \{1,2\} $: Location type of team $ t $: 1 = remote, 2 = onsite.
\end{itemize}

\end{document}
```

- **EntityName** and **EntityAttribute** strictly reference entries from `Entities.csv`.

Write it into a code-block for a LaTeX (.tex) file and provide the generated Latex code in chat.
The file consists of a introduction page with Title, Author, Date and Table of Contents.
The actual file contest consists of 5 different \sections labeled "1. Sets (Entities)", "2. Indices", "3. Goals", "4. Conditions", "5. DecisionVariables"

content_list.content:
Here is the complete LaTeX `.tex` file code, formatted with a title page, author, date, table of contents, and five structured sections. It integrates all previously defined CSV data into a formal optimization model with mathematical and logical expressions for **Goals** and **Conditions**.

```latex
\documentclass[12pt]{article}
\usepackage{amsmath, amssymb, geometry, hyperref, enumitem}
\geometry{margin=1in}
\title{Optimization Model for SCRUM-Based Software Development}
\author{Domain Modeling System}
\date{\today}

\begin{document}

\maketitle

\tableofcontents
\newpage

\section{1. Sets (Entities)}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $ \mathcal{P} $: Set of Projects $ = \{ p \in \text{Project} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{T} $: Set of Teams $ = \{ t \in \text{Team} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{W} $: Set of Workers $ = \{ w \in \text{Worker} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{F} $: Set of Features $ = \{ f \in \text{Feature} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{S} $: Set of Skills $ = \{ s \in \text{Skill} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{R} $: Set of Roles $ = \{ r \in \text{Role} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{PO} $: Set of Product Owners $ = \{ po \in \text{ProductOwner} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SM} $: Set of Scrum Masters $ = \{ sm \in \text{ScrumMaster} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{PB} $: Set of Product Backlogs $ = \{ pb \in \text{ProductBacklog} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SP} $: Set of Sprints $ = \{ sp \in \text{Sprint} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SPP} $: Set of Sprint Plannings $ = \{ spp \in \text{SprintPlanning} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{DS} $: Set of Daily Scrums $ = \{ ds \in \text{DailyScrum} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SR} $: Set of Sprint Reviews $ = \{ sr \in \text{SprintReview} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SRE} $: Set of Sprint Retrospectives $ = \{ sre \in \text{SprintRetrospective} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SBL} $: Set of Sprint Backlogs $ = \{ sbl \in \text{SprintBacklog} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SG} $: Set of Sprint Goals $ = \{ sg \in \text{SprintGoal} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{E} $: Set of Epics $ = \{ e \in \text{Epic} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{US} $: Set of User Stories $ = \{ us \in \text{UserStory} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{TSK} $: Set of Tasks $ = \{ tsk \in \text{Task} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{DEV} $: Set of Development Snapshots $ = \{ dev \in \text{DevelopmentSnapshot} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{BL} $: Set of Blockers $ = \{ bl \in \text{Blocker} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SH} $: Set of Stakeholders $ = \{ sh \in \text{Stakeholder} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{VEL} $: Set of Velocity Records $ = \{ vel \in \text{Velocity} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{REP} $: Set of Release Plans $ = \{ rep \in \text{ReleasePlan} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{RM} $: Set of Roadmaps $ = \{ rm \in \text{Roadmap} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SCB} $: Set of Scrum Boards $ = \{ scb \in \text{ScrumBoard} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{FED} $: Set of Feature Documentations $ = \{ fed \in \text{FeatureDocumentation} \} $
\end{itemize}

\section{2. Indices}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $ p \in \mathcal{P} $: Index for Projects
    \item $ t \in \mathcal{T} $: Index for Teams
    \item $ w \in \mathcal{W} $: Index for Workers
    \item $ f \in \mathcal{F} $: Index for Features
    \item $ s \in \mathcal{S} $: Index for Skills
    \item $ r \in \mathcal{R} $: Index for Roles
    \item $ po \in \mathcal{PO} $: Index for Product Owners
    \item $ sm \in \mathcal{SM} $: Index for Scrum Masters
    \item $ pb \in \mathcal{PB} $: Index for Product Backlogs
    \item $ sp \in \mathcal{SP} $: Index for Sprints
    \item $ sbl \in \mathcal{SBL} $: Index for Sprint Backlogs
    \item $ sg \in \mathcal{SG} $: Index for Sprint Goals
    \item $ e \in \mathcal{E} $: Index for Epics
    \item $ us \in \mathcal{US} $: Index for User Stories
    \item $ tsk \in \mathcal{TSK} $: Index for Tasks
    \item $ bl \in \mathcal{BL} $: Index for Blockers
    \item $ sh \in \mathcal{SH} $: Index for Stakeholders
    \item $ vel \in \mathcal{VEL} $: Index for Velocity Records
    \item $ rep \in \mathcal{REP} $: Index for Release Plans
    \item $ rm \in \mathcal{RM} $: Index for Roadmaps
    \item $ fed \in \mathcal{FED} $: Index for Feature Documentations
\end{itemize}

\section{3. Goals}
\begin{itemize}
    \item \textbf{G0: maximize\_team\_productivity} \\
    Maximize average story points completed per sprint. \\
    $ \max \sum_{vel \in \mathcal{VEL}} \text{avg\_story\_points}(vel) \times \text{Weight}_{G0} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G0} = 1.2 $

    \item \textbf{G1: minimize\_sprint\_blockers} \\
    Minimize number of unresolved blockers. \\
    $ \min \sum_{bl \in \mathcal{BL}} \mathbb{I}[\text{status}(bl) \neq \text{'resolved'}] \times \text{Weight}_{G1} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G1} = 1.5 $

    \item \textbf{G2: maximize\_feature\_completion} \\
    Maximize number of completed features. \\
    $ \max \sum_{f \in \mathcal{F}} \mathbb{I}[\text{status}(f) = \text{'completed'}] \times \text{Weight}_{G2} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G2} = 1.3 $

    \item \textbf{G3: minimize\_project\_duration} \\
    Minimize total project duration. \\
    $ \min \sum_{p \in \mathcal{P}} (\text{project\_end}(p) - \text{project\_start}(p)) \times \text{Weight}_{G3} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G3} = 1.1 $

    \item \textbf{G4: maximize\_worker\_utilization} \\
    Maximize worker availability. \\
    $ \max \sum_{w \in \mathcal{W}} \text{availability}(w) \times \text{Weight}_{G4} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G4} = 0.9 $

    \item \textbf{G5: minimize\_task\_effort\_deviation} \\
    Minimize deviation between estimated and actual effort. \\
    $ \min \sum_{tsk \in \mathcal{TSK}} |\text{effort}(tsk) - \text{actual\_effort}(tsk)| \times \text{Weight}_{G5} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G5} = 1.0 $

    \item \textbf{G6: maximize\_stakeholder\_influence} \\
    Maximize involvement of high-influence stakeholders. \\
    $ \max \sum_{sh \in \mathcal{SH}} \text{influence\_level}(sh) \times \text{Weight}_{G6} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G6} = 0.8 $

    \item \textbf{G7: minimize\_epic\_estimated\_effort} \\
    Minimize total estimated effort for epics. \\
    $ \min \sum_{e \in \mathcal{E}} \text{estimated\_effort}(e) \times \text{Weight}_{G7} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G7} = 1.2 $

    \item \textbf{G8: maximize\_sprint\_goal\_achievement} \\
    Maximize number of achieved sprint goals. \\
    $ \max \sum_{sg \in \mathcal{SG}} \mathbb{I}[\text{achievement\_status}(sg) = \text{'achieved'}] \times \text{Weight}_{G8} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G8} = 1.4 $

    \item \textbf{G9: minimize\_daily\_scrum\_duration} \\
    Minimize average daily scrum duration. \\
    $ \min \frac{1}{|\mathcal{DS}|} \sum_{ds \in \mathcal{DS}} \text{duration}(ds) \times \text{Weight}_{G9} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G9} = 0.7 $

    \item \textbf{G10: maximize\_documentation\_coverage} \\
    Maximize features with linked documentation. \\
    $ \max \sum_{fed \in \mathcal{FED}} \mathbb{I}[\text{linked\_requirements}(fed) \neq \emptyset] \times \text{Weight}_{G10} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G10} = 0.9 $

    \item \textbf{G11: minimize\_release\_plan\_delays} \\
    Minimize delayed release plans. \\
    $ \min \sum_{rep \in \mathcal{REP}} \mathbb{I}[\text{status}(rep) = \text{'delayed'}] \times \text{Weight}_{G11} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G11} = 1.3 $

    \item \textbf{G12: maximize\_team\_stability} \\
    Maximize number of active teams. \\
    $ \max \sum_{t \in \mathcal{T}} \mathbb{I}[\text{team\_status}(t) = \text{'active'}] \times \text{Weight}_{G12} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G12} = 1.0 $

    \item \textbf{G13: minimize\_worker\_turnover} \\
    Minimize inactive workers. \\
    $ \min \sum_{w \in \mathcal{W}} \mathbb{I}[\text{status}(w) = \text{'inactive'}] \times \text{Weight}_{G13} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G13} = 1.4 $

    \item \textbf{G14: maximize\_sprint\_velocity\_trend} \\
    Maximize positive velocity trend. \\
    $ \max \sum_{vel \in \mathcal{VEL}} \text{trend}(vel) \times \text{Weight}_{G14} $ \\
    where $ \text{Weight}_{G14} = 1.1 $
\end{itemize}

\section{4. Conditions}
\begin{itemize}
    \item \textbf{C0: require\_worker\_email} \\
    Every worker must have a valid email. \\
    $ \forall w \in \mathcal{W}: \text{email}(w) \neq \text{null} \land \text{email}(w) \text{ matches } \texttt{email\_regex} $

    \item \textbf{C1: require\_unique\_role\_assignment} \\
    A worker can assume only one role per team. \\
    $ \forall w \in \mathcal{W}, t \in \mathcal{T}: \left| \{ r \in \mathcal{R} \mid (w,r) \in \text{takes\_on\_role} \land w \in t \} \right| \leq 1 $

    \item \textbf{C2: enforce\_sprint\_duration} \\
    Sprint duration must be 1 to 4 weeks. \\
    $ \forall sp \in \mathcal{SP}: 7 \leq (\text{end\_date}(sp) - \text{start\_date}(sp)) \leq 28 \text{ days} $

    \item \textbf{C3: require\_product\_backlog\_entries} \\
    Product Backlog must have at least one entry. \\
    $ \forall pb \in \mathcal{PB}: \text{number\_of\_entries}(pb) \geq 1 $

    \item \textbf{C4: ensure\_task\_status\_validity} \\
    Task status must be valid. \\
    $ \forall tsk \in \mathcal{TSK}: \text{status}(tsk) \in \{ \text{todo}, \text{in\_progress}, \text{done} \} $

    \item \textbf{C5: require\_sprint\_goal\_defined} \\
    Every sprint must have a defined goal. \\
    $ \forall sp \in \mathcal{SP}: \exists sg \in \mathcal{SG} \mid \text{pursues\_goal}(sp, sg) \land \text{objective\_description}(sg) \neq \text{null} $

    \item \textbf{C6: enforce\_user\_story\_priority} \\
    User Story must have a priority level. \\
    $ \forall us \in \mathcal{US}: \text{priority}(us) \in \{1,2,3\} $

    \item \textbf{C7: require\_feature\_title} \\
    Feature must have a title. \\
    $ \forall f \in \mathcal{F}: \text{title}(f) \neq \text{null} \land \text{title}(f) \neq "" $

    \item \textbf{C8: ensure\_team\_size\_within\_range} \\
    Team size must be between 3 and 9. \\
    $ \forall t \in \mathcal{T}: 3 \leq \text{team\_size}(t) \leq 9 $

    \item \textbf{C9: require\_epic\_status} \\
    Epic must have a valid status. \\
    $ \forall e \in \mathcal{E}: \text{status}(e) \in \{ \text{planned}, \text{in\_progress}, \text{done} \} $

    \item \textbf{C10: enforce\_documentation\_author} \\
    Feature documentation must have an author. \\
    $ \forall fed \in \mathcal{FED}: \text{author}(fed) \neq \text{null} $

    \item \textbf{C11: require\_sprint\_review\_attendees} \\
    Sprint Review must have attendees. \\
    $ \forall sr \in \mathcal{SR}: \text{attendees\_count}(sr) \geq 1 $

    \item \textbf{C12: ensure\_blocker\_severity} \\
    Blocker must have a severity level. \\
    $ \forall bl \in \mathcal{BL}: \text{severity}(bl) \in \{ \text{low}, \text{medium}, \text{high}, \text{critical} \} $

    \item \textbf{C13: require\_release\_version} \\
    Release Plan must specify a version. \\
    $ \forall rep \in \mathcal{REP}: \text{version}(rep) \neq \text{null} $

    \item \textbf{C14: enforce\_roadmap\_milestones} \\
    Roadmap must include milestones. \\
    $ \forall rm \in \mathcal{RM}: \text{milestones}(rm) \neq \text{null} \land |\text{milestones}(rm)| \geq 1 $
\end{itemize}

\section{5. DecisionVariables}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $ \mathbf{x}_{tsk,w} \in \{0,1\} $: Task assignment â€” 1 if task $ tsk $ is assigned to worker $ w $, else 0.
    \item $ a_w \in [0, 40] \subset \mathbb{R} $: Weekly availability of worker $ w $ in hours.
    \item $ d_{sp} \in \{1,2,3,4\} $: Duration of sprint $ sp $ in weeks.
    \item $ s_t \in [3,9] \subset \mathbb{Z} $: Size of team $ t $.
    \item $ sp_{us} \in [1,13] \subset \mathbb{Z} $: Story points estimated for user story $ us $.
    \item $ e_{tsk} \in [0, 40] \subset \mathbb{R} $: Effort (in hours) planned for task $ tsk $.
    \item $ p_f \in \{1,2,3\} $: Priority level of feature $ f $.
    \item $ p_{us} \in \{1,2,3\} $: Priority of user story $ us $.
    \item $ \tau_{rep} \in [1704067200, 2085984000] \subset \mathbb{Z} $: Unix timestamp of planned release date for $ rep $.
    \item $ n_{vel} \in [2,6] \subset \mathbb{Z} $: Number of sprints used in velocity calculation.
    \item $ \delta_{fed} \in \{0,1\} $: 1 if documentation $ fed $ is complete, else 0.
    \item $ r_{bl} \in [0, 720] \subset \mathbb{R} $: Time (in hours) to resolve blocker $ bl $.
    \item $ \gamma_{sg} \in [0.0, 1.0] \subset \mathbb{R} $: Achievement score of sprint goal $ sg $.
    \item $ l_s \in [1,5] \subset \mathbb{Z} $: Skill level of worker in skill $ s $.
    \item $ \ell_t \in \{1,2\} $: Location type of team $ t $: 1 = remote, 2 = onsite.
\end{itemize}

\end{document}
```
